Pretty interesting, right? But did you

these cabs aren't just numbers. These
are GPS recorders driving around in our
city streets recording each and every
ride they take. There's data there. And
I looked at that data and I made a plot
of the average speed of taxis in New
York City throughout the day. Well, you
can see that from about midnight to
around 5:18 in the morning, speed
increases. And at that point, things
turn around. They get slower and slower
and slower until about 8:35 in the
morning when they end up at around 11 12
mph. The average taxi is going 11 and a
half miles per hour in our city streets.
And it turns out it stays that way for
the entire
day. The entire day. So I said to

New York City. There's just a rush
day. Makes sense, right? And this is
important for a couple reasons. Like if

They would park there and the NYPD

for 5 years, this spot was being
